message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the emissions produced by different forms of transportation. Motorbikes, speed boats, and hybrid cars all produce emissions, either through the burning of fossil fuels or the use of electricity generated by fossil fuels. Pedal bikes, on the other hand, have zero emissions because they are powered by human energy and do not require any external fuel source. Therefore, option (D) is the correct answer.

This question requires basic knowledge about the environmental impact of different forms of transportation. Option (D), pedal bikes, have zero emissions because they are powered solely by human energy and do not rely on any form of fuel or combustion. Option (A), motorbikes, typically run on gasoline or other fossil fuels, so they do produce emissions. Option (B), speed boats, typically run on gasoline or diesel fuels and also produce emissions. Option (C), hybrid cars, are designed to be more fuel efficient and produce fewer emissions than traditional gasoline-powered cars, but they still produce some emissions.

This question requires knowledge about different forms of transportation and their environmental impact. Option (D) is the correct answer because pedal bikes do not emit any pollutants or greenhouse gases since they are powered solely by human energy. Option (A) is incorrect because motorbikes use fossil fuels and emit exhaust emissions. Option (B) is also incorrect because speed boats typically use gasoline or diesel engines, which produce emissions. Option (C) is incorrect because although hybrid cars are more fuel-efficient and produce fewer emissions than traditional vehicles, they still emit some level of pollutants.

This question requires knowledge about different forms of transportation and their emissions. Motorbikes (option A) and speed boats (option B) are not forms of transportation that have zero emissions. Hybrid cars (option C) are more environmentally friendly than traditional gasoline-powered cars, but they still emit some emissions. Pedal bikes (option D), however, do not emit any emissions because they are powered solely by human effort. Therefore, the correct answer is option D.

To determine the correct answer, we need to consider the environmental impact of each form of transportation. Motorbikes (Option A) and speed boats (Option B) both consume fossil fuels and produce emissions, so they are not the correct answer. Hybrid cars (Option C) use a combination of fuel sources, including gasoline, so they still produce some emissions. Pedal bikes (Option D), on the other hand, do not require any fuel or emit any emissions because they are powered solely by human effort. Therefore, Option D, pedal bikes, is the correct answer.

Option (A) is incorrect because motorbikes use gasoline or other fuels that produce emissions. Option (B) is incorrect because speed boats typically run on gasoline or diesel fuel, which produce emissions. Option (C) is incorrect because while hybrid cars have lower emissions compared to traditional gasoline-powered cars, they still produce some emissions.

Option (A), motorbikes, are powered by fossil fuels and emit carbon dioxide and other pollutants. Option (B), speed boats, are also powered by fossil fuels and release emissions into the air and water. Option (C), hybrid cars, are more environmentally friendly than traditional gasoline-powered cars because they use a combination of a gasoline engine and an electric motor. While they emit less emissions compared to conventional cars, they still have some level of emissions.
